I sent an email to Viterbi Graduate Admission specifically asking about the people who were not invited to the last event (Feb 19th - posted even on Instagram) and about our chances (I mean, if that non-invitation was an expected reject). The response basically was: "the most of decisions will be sent to April 15th". Besides, for them, it's impossible to indicate when a certain application is reviewed. TTPB: I was referring to your first post, I know that in the second post you said unlikely, but I was pointing out that there's an inconsistency in your first and second post since your first post didn't indicate any exception to admits being finalized.

Do you understand the difference between 'unlikely' and 'impossible'? Admissions are finalized and sent out but students may decline offers, which means it is unlikely to get acceptance by now but not impossible. The more you rely on false hopes, the more you would be disappointed when you got rejection in the end.

TTPB: You initially claimed that your POI stated that all admits were finalized though, even giving exact numbers of how many. If they're still sending offers to people from the shortlist why would your POI say all admits are finalized?

I'm the one received message from POI told offers are finalized. Chances are quite low for rest of us, but it is not impossible. People get accepted may decline the offer, then prof has to give offers to other students in his shortlist.

Sherri.
